title: 2-year-old critically hurt in accidental shooting near a KCK Little Caesars
content:
You need to have the Adobe Flash Player to view this content. Please click here to continue.
KANSAS CITY, Kan. – On Friday night in KCK a 2-year-old boy was critically hurt in a shooting. Police say the shooting was accidental, and happened around 10 p.m. near 75th and State Avenue.
BREAKING: 2 year old is in critical condition after being accidentally shot at a KCK Little Caesers
— Megan Brilley (@meganbrilley) November 5, 2016
An officer on scene said the boy was inside a car with his mom when he was shot. Police say the shots were fired inside the car, and the mom ran inside a nearby Little Caesars for help.
The boy was rushed to the hospital in critical condition. Police interviewed employees of the Little Caesars and canvassed the parking lot. No arrests have been made yet.
FOX 4 will continue to follow developments with this story, and provide updates over the weekend as more information is released.
